arm_group.description: In this arm, daily nitrogen supply is as much as 2.5-3.0 g per kilogram (ideal body weight)
In this arm, daily nitrogen supply is 1.2-1.5g per kilogram (ideal body weight) as recommended by ESPEN guideline

brief_summary.textblock:
The patients with sepsis are in high risk of malnutrition, which could contribute to
      infection, difficulty in weaning from ventilators. The investigators speculate whether
      nutrition therapy with high nitrogen could attenuate the malnutrition status and improve the
      outcome in these sepsis patients. In this prospective Randomized Controlled Trial, the
      investigators aim to compare high nitrogen intake with conventional nitrogen supply which
      were recommended in guidelines.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial to Assess the Effect of High Nitrogen Intake in Patients With Sepsis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  sepsis or septic shock

          -  predicted ICU stay more than 7 days

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  irreversible status of primary disease

          -  any history of malnutrition before enrollment

          -  history of steroid cortisol administration

intervention.description: Nitrogen supply could be administered through amino acid in parenteral nutrition, proteins in enteral nutrition and IV albumin.

facility.name: Division of Critical Care Medicine: Zhongshan Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of High Nitrogen Intake in Patients With Sepsis: a Prospective Randomized and Controlled Trial

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Vice Professor of Division of Critical Care Medicine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: patients enrolled will be followed for the duration of mechanical ventilation, an expcected average of 4 weeks
patients enrolled will be followed for length of ICU stay, an expected average of 6 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Details of infection includes pneumonia, catheter-related blood stream infection, urinary tract infect, et al. Diagnosis of infection accords to symptoms, lab tests, imaging measurements and bacterial cultures.
Liver function is assessed through serum bilirubin and liver enzyme, renal function is assessed through serum urea nitrogen and creatinine.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: on 1st. day, 3rd. day, 7th. day, 14th. day, 21st. day, 28th. day after enrollment

secondary_outcome.description: diameter of the muscle is measured with percutaneous ultrasound
secondary_outcome.measure: diameter of midpoint of musculus rectus femoris
secondary_outcome.time_frame: on 28th. day or endpoint of the trial

secondary_outcome.measure: serum concentration of albumin, pre albumin, retinaldehyde binding protein, transferrin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: on 7th. day , 14th. day, 21st. day, 28th. day after enrollment

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver), Primary Purpose: Treatment
